channel.title: Clarification on meeting times - UTC/timezone issues
channel.description:
Can we clarify this?
I thought the meetings were defined at a UTC time - https://www.w3.org/wiki/SocialCG#Meetings says
> Meetings in general are alternating Fridays and Saturdays. On Friday at 1700 UTC and Saturday at 1500 UTC.
However today's meeting happened at a different time: https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/2021-05-01-fediverse-interest-group-meeting/1649
> * 2pm UTC
I think I know what happened, based on another comment on that post:
> Per [the calendar ](https://cloud.w3c.social/apps/calendar/p/GzxsDfE6CKtp9MHX/dayGridMonth/now)
So this meeting was set based on the NextCloud calendar.
The problem is, that calendar - the NextCloud one - has a timezone "bug". It's set to reoccur an event in London time **NOT** UTC time - ie, it stays 3 oclock (London Time) whenever the event is in the year. However, the event is defined at UTC time so if you then look at London time you should see the event time (London time) shift by an hour over the year.
I did point this out when the calendar was created: https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/socialcg-meetings-calendar/1308/2?u=jarofgreen
The ActivtyPub aware event listing I put together carefully always created events at UTC time - so if you look down the page (it should open showing them in London time) you'll see they jump by an hour at one point: https://denof.theoccasionoctopus.net/a/w3_social_web_incubator_community_group/manage/event?eventListFilterDataSubmitted=1&showCancelled=1&set_timezone=Europe/London
So this is a long winded way of saying it's not my fault I was late for the meeting :-)
**But seriously; can we clarify meeting start times for future?**
https://www.w3.org/wiki/SocialCG#Meetings says 1500 UTC
https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/2021-05-01-fediverse-interest-group-meeting/1649 says 2pm UTC.
Something is wrong
